summary: The concept of "charcoal" is classified under the wood industry category within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. It is described in various provisions and annexes of customs codes, ensuring a uniform application across member states. Charcoal, as a good, is subject to specific tariff classifications, which are indicated in a statistical table that adds clarity to trade regulations. Pursuant to established rules, certain subdivisions of charcoal are referred to for additional interpretation, ensuring that all goods are wholly or partly compliant with EU standards. This classification is essential for the effective regulation of trade and the application of appropriate customs duties.
